results.title: The Presidency: search for a candidate
results.creator_credit: United Press International Television News, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Maurice Schonfeld
results.brief_description: Every four years the political parties of the United States engage in an internal power struggle in the process of nominating candidates for the presidency. The big effort at the party convention - and in the preconvention campaigns - is to find the man who can win. This film portrays the variety of means a contestant can successfully pursue to become his party’s candidate. Original footage of conventions is used to illustrate the selection process. Narrated by Robert Ryan.

results.title: The Present from Gondwanaland
results.creator_credit: Mike Weatherley and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Up a gum tree”.
Two hundred million years ago the giant continent Gondwanaland split and Australia drifted away. Its plants and animals evolved in isolation from the rest of the world. How does a tree used as a prison fit into the story and what are the secrets of the gum tree’s success? Narrated by David Bellamy.

results.title: The Preschooler's mind
results.creator_credit: Harry Ratner, Southern California Consortium and Coastline Community College
results.brief_description:
Episode number 13 of Series “Time to grow”.
Studies the surge in children’s development between ages two and a half and six which Piaget describes as a progression from prelogical to operational logical thinking.

results.title: The Preparation of food: Stone age to space age
results.brief_description: Discusses the increasing importance of food ad its preparation, particularly when men are confined for long periods of time in space stations similar to NASA’s Lunar Receiving Laboratories.

results.title: The Prefects
results.creator_credit: Phoenix Films and Brian S Lofts
results.brief_description: Prefects at a boys’ school are seen exercising their authority, giving detentions and confiscating articles. They set up a roof garden serving alcohol, complete with a warning device, but when they fail to notice the signal they are caught, demoted and the staff take over the garden, with the boys to serve them.

results.title: The Precursors: Cezanne, Gaugin, Van Gogh
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau, Les Films du Cypres, Pierre Alibert and Danielle Van De Putte
results.brief_description: Portrays the influence of impressionism as exemplified in Cezanne’s preoccupation with construction, Gauguin’s use of descriptive backgrounds and Van Gough’s attempt to evoke emotion rather than display craftsmanship. Narrated by Phillip Gaunt.

results.title: The Pre-School child
results.creator_credit: Eileen Molony, George Inger and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Springs of learning”.
The year before school starts is full of opportunity: the four year old is manually more dexterous, and physically more adventurous than the three year old. He cooperates with others, concentrates more and undertakes responsibility for specific tasks.

results.title: The Pre-Raphaelite revolt
results.creator_credit: Anne Balfour Fraser, Samaritan Films and David Thompson
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the philosophy of the Pre-Raphaelite painters, who made a concerted effort to “save” art by returning to the “truth of nature”. The narration and the visual content evoke the era of the Pre-Raphaelite in around 1848. The film helps to clarify the individual approaches of the painters and how they achieved the return to nature. Narrated by John Wood and poems of Tennyson, D.G. Rossetti and Christina Rossetti read by Freda Dowie. A fasinating and interesting film.

results.title: The Practical princess (K)
results.creator_credit: Nick Bosustow, Bosustow Entertainment and Sam Weiss
results.brief_description: When Princess Bedelia was born, the fairies gave her three gifts: beauty, grace and common sense. Her father thinks beautiful princesses don’t need common sense, but Bedelia makes good use of her brains. Based on the book by Jay Williams with animation by Vicente Bassol.
